text: What are the top 3 most frustrating aspects of the current process for your team?
How often do these issues occur and what's the business impact in terms of time, cost, or customer satisfaction?
Which teams or departments are most affected by these problems? Who else should we involve in this discussion?
What workarounds are people currently using to deal with these issues? What does that tell us about the root cause?
What are the non-negotiable constraints we need to work within? Budget, timeline, technical limitations?
How frequently do these problems occur? Daily, weekly, monthly? And what triggers them?
On a scale of 1-10, how severe is the impact of these problems on your daily operations?
What specific metrics or KPIs are being affected by these problems? Revenue, efficiency, customer satisfaction?
What manual processes or workarounds have you developed to cope with these issues?
If we could solve these problems, what would success look like for your team?
What event or condition triggers the start of this process? How do you know when to begin?
How do you know when this process is complete? What's the final deliverable or outcome?
Who are all the people involved in this process? What role does each person play?
How do you hand off work between different people or departments? What information is passed along?
What systems or tools do you use in this process? Which screens or features are most important?
What key data do you capture or work with? Who owns or maintains this data?
What happens when things don't go according to plan? How do you handle exceptions or errors?
How many transactions or cases do you process? What's the typical volume and any seasonal patterns?
What are the time expectations for each step? Are there any service level agreements or deadlines?
Which steps in the current process are most time-consuming or error-prone?
What specific outcomes do you want to achieve with the improved process?
What value will this bring to the business? How will we measure success?
What are the non-negotiable constraints we must work within?
How will we know if the new process is successful? What metrics should we track?
What dependencies exist? What needs to happen before we can implement this?
What impact will this change have on other processes or systems?
How ready is the organization for this change? What resistance might we face?
What signals will indicate we're ready to roll out the new process?
What's a realistic timeline for implementing these changes?
What risks should we consider in the new process design?
What are 2-3 different approaches we could take to solve this problem?
How feasible is each option given our constraints and resources?
What are the trade-offs between cost, time, and risk for each option?
What risks are associated with each solution option? How can we mitigate them?
How should we pilot or test the preferred solution? What criteria define success?
What's the best approach for rolling out the solution? Phased or big bang?
What specific criteria must be met for the solution to be considered successful?
What resources (people, technology, budget) will each option require?
How long will it take to implement each option? What are the key milestones?
How will we measure the success of the chosen solution? What KPIs should we track?
